Onderwerp: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Macbeth

Jon & Ewout:

I am not so sure  the idea of a transliterating keyboard driver is a good idea.  It reminds me of training wheels on a bicycle.  When I was five, I rode my bicycle for a year with training wheels attached to the rear wheel.  When my father finally took them off, we discovered I still did not know how to balance because the training wheels had kept me from  having to.  But after they came off, I learned to ride the same day.

You've got a point. But the keyboard driver allows us to remap the whole keyboard too, putting the short forms under more logical keys. The font-file needn't be touched for this, so old texts in quickscript can still be read using the same font.

[snip]

Shavian has no half-letters so the Shavian mapping did not have to take that issue into account.  Since Quikscript does use half-letters, it would make sense to me that those letters should be produced by using the shift key along with the same key that produces the whole letter.  Example:  "peep" mapped to "p", "half-peep" mapped to shift "p."  "Day" and "half-day" to be mapped the same way on "d" and shift "d."  And so forth.

The driver can do just this, but also apply automatic conversion to the half forms when possible. This will take some work, but it can be done. I have seen how nicely the Arabic driver works, so this should be just as possible.

Ewout
